name: RBI Grade B Officer
description: A highly competitive national-level examination conducted by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) for the recruitment of Grade B Officers (General, DEPR, and DSIM cadres). It is one of the most prestigious jobs in the Indian banking sector, offering a fast-track career in the country's central bank.

eligibility.ageLimit: 21 to 30 years. Age relaxation is provided for specified categories (e.g., OBC, SC/ST, PwBD) and for candidates with M.Phil. and Ph.D. qualifications as per RBI norms.
eligibility.educationalQualification: For General (DR) post: A minimum of 60% marks (50% for SC/ST/PwBD) in a Bachelor's degree as well as in 12th (or Diploma or equivalent) and 10th standard examinations. Specific qualifications are required for DEPR and DSIM posts.
eligibility.nationality: A Citizen of India, or a subject of Nepal/Bhutan, or a Tibetan refugee who came to India before January 1, 1962.
eligibility.numberOfAttempts: Candidates belonging to the General Category are permitted a maximum of 6 attempts for the Phase-I examination. There is no restriction for SC/ST/OBC/PwBD candidates.

timeline.notificationDate: May 9, 2023 (for 2023 cycle). The 2024 notification is awaited.
timeline.resultDate: Final result for the 2023 cycle was declared on December 13, 2023.

examPattern.mode: Phase-I: Online (Objective). Phase-II: Online (Objective + Descriptive/Keyboard-based). Interview: In-person.

stages.name: Stage 1: Phase-I Examination (Preliminary)
stages.description: An online objective test of 200 marks lasting 120 minutes. It has four sections: General Awareness, English Language, Quantitative Aptitude, and Reasoning. This is a qualifying examination.

stages.name: Stage 2: Phase-II Examination (Main)
stages.description: Consists of three papers (total 300 marks). Paper-I (Economic & Social Issues) and Paper-III (Finance & Management) are a mix of objective and descriptive questions. Paper-II (English - Writing Skills) is fully descriptive.

stages.name: Stage 3: Interview
stages.description: Candidates shortlisted after Phase-II are called for a Psychometric Test and a Personal Interview. The interview carries 75 marks. Final selection is based on the combined marks of Phase-II and the Interview.

examPattern.markingScheme: For objective questions in both Phase-I and Phase-II, 1/4th of the marks assigned to the question will be deducted for each wrong answer.

syllabus.name: Phase I: Reasoning, English & Quant
topics: Puzzles, Seating Arrangement, Syllogism, Critical Reasoning

syllabus.name: Phase II Paper I: Economic and Social Issues (ESI)
Phase II Paper II: English (Writing Skills)
Phase II Paper III: Finance and Management (F&M)
topics: Recent Developments in the Financial Sector
